etymons.notes: ṭry2 надо как-то изменить это обозначение или вообще убрать cf. LS 551: to strike against, push; to expel; to torment, trouble; set, fix

Preterit.turoyo: 1) lə=ṭreleoḏəʕkītgubo 334; 75/114; u=laly-awo, amṭé-wa-llal-li l-u=axur-awolə=ṭralledomaxnoappe LB 131; fayišinaʕaǧēbmayi m-i=kurk-aṯe, w-áydarbo lo=ṭrela i=kurf-aṯemḥayṣločičə́k me diḏa
translations: ‘We remained astonished by the hen, and the way she did not
allow that snake to catch one of her chicken’

Preterit.turoyo: 2) ṭrele u=babo w i=emo 334; 24/94; m-u=săbab-anoṭreləxann=abnayḏəxdayimayatume w faqire! 11/66; ṭreli i=dəsmāl-ayo d-kət-waḥəṣtoʕalʕayniṭəryolitamo LB 200; mašteleann=aḥənone w-i=barṯo d-u=malko; bəṯərməd-štalleṭralle b-gawə-d-u=gubow-azzə́n’; 21/75 [MT]; kulṣafro, kulʕasriyekə-mḥalaq-le u=mukl-ayḏe am=ma-ayḏe, w-ṭreletamoyaṣiro ‘’; 24/279; lo=ṭralleḥakimo b-u=aṯrano d-l-amṭalla-lle-yo
translations: ‘There was not a (single) doctor in that country that they had not brought to him’ (lit. ‘They did not leave a doctor in that country that they had not brought to him’) MM 16;

Preterit.turoyo: 5) maqnaʕʕe b-i=ṣurt-aṯe, ṭrelemene ‘’; 24/10 [MT]; u=babosowoṭrelemene ‘’; 24/94; i=naqladə-ḥzéla-li, ṭrela m-ač=čīčkat, w-m-i=kurke
translations: ‘When she (snake, fem.) saw me, she let the chicken and the hen alone’

Infectum.turoyo: 1) qay lo=k-ṭŭretu d-oṯən 358; prs 123/33; ono lə=g-ṭorenomedeoṯeaʕluxLB 282;lə=g-ṭoren-ux gabi ; lalyoḥreno d-aloho d-l=obetədard w-bala, g-ṭuryonoBadrxan Bag d-owe u=ḏ̣ayf-ayḏoxlu=k-ṭurenonošo m-u=ʕulmo d-ad= dəžmən d-oṯemobəlaʕ=ʕeze w-a=ʕwone w-ag=gaml-ayḏan

ko-faš-le tretloṯo=dawqe ko-ṭoral-le l-ruḥe116/15; w k-qayimi a=tre k-ṭorənaǧ=ǧulaṯṯe-ste 6/98; k-ubʕono d-obətwaʕdaʕmiḥatta d-ṭurat-lanharke, hul d-ḥuzenaməgəd-howe mə-šuġlayna ‘; 24/176 [MT] ; ádyouma d-ṭuréno-ləxbayt-ayḏidemák ki lat-li šaraflat-li namūslu=g-ṭureno i=ḏərriyemene g-quṭáʕn-ən, g-quṭánnu-llekulle
3) a=greʕ-ayḏaġălabefṣiḥoye-ne mina lo=ko-ṭəryolebe d-nošokallawat k-oba-llexud k-əbʕi
translations: ‘Her servants were happy. She (the mistress) would not leave anyone unhappy. She would give them as much gold as they wanted’ 77/194;

Infectum.turoyo: 5) babo, kan uno d-ṭorətmeni b-sulḥ w-insaniye k-ubaʕnomenox lo=b-ǧabriye
translations: , so bitte ich dich, in Frieden und
‘She would not leave anyone in the city
‘The inhabitants of Mardin did not allow us to cross the border’ EL 81;

Infectum-wa.turoyo: 2) d-doyaq-waarbaʕ=pallat m-i=tuṯ-aṯe, doyáq-wa-lle w ṭoré-wa-lle me-ṣafraytohulʕaṣriye b-i=šəmš-aṯe, …, ʕayne g-nayḥi-wa 370; 70/271; i=naqqa d-ṭŭréno-wo-le sarbast, fŭyar-wo b-u=mamro 11/266; kət-teʕade l-aq=qabayəl d-aʕ=ʕarab, u=ḥa d-nufal-wo b-ǧídari <...> gəd-ṭurán-wo-le b-i=dukṯo w-mahzimi-wo aʕ=ʕarabkullemə-gabe

Imperativ.turoyo: 1) ṭray d-moṭe 372; walawlu=k-qodər, bas ṭray-le ṭro-oṯehano-sse, balkialoho b-i=waṣṭ-ayḏeʕal-iḏe ube-la šafa! ‘’; 24/63

translations: ‘Let the burden (pl) down here, go away and leave it (pl)!’; 38/9 [MT];
‘Uncle! Leave a slice [of bread] for the aunt!’; 44/62

Imperativ.turoyo: 4) ṭray me-ruḥux w izúx 372; 57/143; 5) ṭrimena 372; prs 61/25;

oməroṯebabəx b-raġle, mar lo=mqadmət l-u=bayto d-u=mērko. ummoṭr-owe 372; prs 31/33; prs 72/28; prs 183/29; 30/11; 60/139; šqul-ləx u=zoġoṭrofoyəšgabəxgəraw d-kallat 372; prs 29/16; haw-la ṭlamṯo d-laḥmo, ṭro d-uxlo 372; 58/170; ṭr-uzzámičokotaḥt u=tarʕo, kurxoʕal u=faṣṣo 373; prs 190/9; hat amer-a w ṭr-əmmielux ko-mdaglat! 373; 54/57; ax=xabred-mǝ́lli-laxkulleṭr-owəneli 373; 67/187;
